cyclone.name: ROSA
cyclone.current_location: about 260 mi southwest of Punta Eugenia, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: tracking north-northeast toward the central-northern Baja California peninsula, then inland across the Desert Southwest
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central to northern Baja California peninsula (near Cabo San Quintin/Punta Eugenia area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: East coast of the Baja California peninsula from Bahia de los Angeles to San Felipe (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: West coast of the Baja California peninsula from Punta Abreojos to Cabo San Quintin (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Baja California peninsula, Gulf of California shores, northwestern Mexico, and portions of southern California and the Desert Southwest
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤4%) of tropical-storm-force winds; breezy with occasional gusts Monday night into Tuesday
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–2 inches of rain possible Monday night through Tuesday, with localized minor flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the southern California coast ahead of the storm
